verses.verse: To the chief <S%H5329><s%> Musician, <S%H5329><s%> even to Jeduthun, <S%H3038><s%> A Psalm <S%H4210><s%> of David. <S%H1732><s%> I said, <S%H559><s%> I will take heed <S%H8104><s%> to my ways, <S%H1870><s%> that I sin <S%H2398><s%> not with my tongue: <S%H3956><s%> I will keep <S%H8104><s%> my mouth <S%H6310><s%> with a bridle, <S%H4269><s%> while <S%H5750><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%> is before <S%H5048><s%> me.
I was dumb <S%H481><s%> with silence, <S%H1747><s%> I held <S%H2814><s%> my peace, <S%H2814><s%> even from good; <S%H2896><s%> and my sorrow <S%H3511><s%> was stirred. <S%H5916><s%>

My heart <S%H3820><s%> was hot <S%H2552><s%> within <S%H7130><s%> me, while I was musing <S%H1901><s%> the fire <S%H784><s%> burned: <S%H1197><s%> then spoke <S%H1696><s%> I with my tongue, <S%H3956><s%>

LORD, <S%H3068><s%> make me to know <S%H3045><s%> my end, <S%H7093><s%> and the measure <S%H4060><s%> of my days, <S%H3117><s%> what <S%H4310><s%> it is: that I may know <S%H3045><s%> how <S%H4100><s%> frail <S%H2310><s%> I am.

Behold, <S%H2009><s%> you have made <S%H5414><s%> my days <S%H3117><s%> as an handbreadth; <S%H2947><s%> and my age <S%H2465><s%> is as nothing <S%H369><s%> before <S%H5048><s%> you: truly <S%H389><s%> every <S%H3605><s%> man <S%H120><s%> at his best <S%H5324><s%> state <S%H5324><s%> is altogether <S%H3605><s%> vanity. <S%H1892><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>

Surely <S%H389><s%> every man <S%H376><s%> walks <S%H1980><s%> in a vain show: <S%H6754><s%> surely <S%H389><s%> they are disquieted <S%H1993><s%> in vain: <S%H1892><s%> he heaps <S%H6651><s%> up riches, and knows <S%H3045><s%> not who <S%H4310><s%> shall gather <S%H622><s%> them.
And now, <S%H6258><s%> Lord, <S%H136><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> wait <S%H6960><s%> I for? my hope <S%H8431><s%> is in you.
Deliver <S%H5337><s%> me from all <S%H3605><s%> my transgressions: <S%H6588><s%> make <S%H7760><s%> me not the reproach <S%H2781><s%> of the foolish. <S%H5036><s%>
I was dumb, <S%H481><s%> I opened <S%H6605><s%> not my mouth; <S%H6310><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> you did <S%H6213><s%> it.
Remove <S%H5493><s%> your stroke <S%H5061><s%> away from me: I am consumed <S%H3615><s%> by the blow <S%H8409><s%> of your hand. <S%H3027><s%>

When you with rebukes <S%H8433><s%> do correct <S%H3256><s%> man <S%H376><s%> for iniquity, <S%H5771><s%> you make his beauty <S%H2530><s%> to consume <S%H4529><s%> away like a moth: <S%H6211><s%> surely <S%H389><s%> every <S%H3605><s%> man <S%H120><s%> is vanity. <S%H1892><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>

Hear <S%H8085><s%> my prayer, <S%H8605><s%> O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> and give ear <S%H238><s%> to my cry; <S%H7775><s%> hold <S%H2790><s%> not your peace <S%H2790><s%> at <S%H413><s%> my tears: <S%H1832><s%> for I am a stranger <S%H1616><s%> with you, and a sojourner, <S%H8453><s%> as all <S%H3605><s%> my fathers <S%H1><s%> were.
O spare <S%H8159><s%> me, that I may recover <S%H1082><s%> strength, <S%H1082><s%> before <S%H2962><s%> I go <S%H3212><s%> hence, <S%H2088><s%> and be no <S%H369><s%> more.
